turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I'm so tired of my current wardrobe. I need a serious refresh but I'm on a *very* tight budget. Like, under $200 tight. Can you give me some fashion recommendations?

turns.speaker: agent

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, okay, fair enough. I'm mostly looking for everyday wear. I'm a size medium in tops and a size 8 in pants. But here's the real kicker: ethically sourced and sustainable clothing is a huge plus for me, but that feels impossible on my budget. What are my options?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Finding ethically sourced and sustainable clothing under $200 can be challenging, but not impossible! Consider exploring secondhand options like ThredUp or Poshmark; you can often find high-quality, pre-owned minimalist pieces for a fraction of the original price. Also, look into brands like Pact or Everlane's "Choose What You Pay" section for discounted, sustainable basics. I can provide links to specific items currently available on those sites if you'd like!
